revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Jason Ritter | image = Jason Ritter TIFF 2015.jpg | caption = Ritter at the [[2015 Toronto Film Festival]] | birth_name = Jason Ritter | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1980|2|17}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | alma_mater= [[New York University]] | occupation = Actor | years_active = 1989–present | parents = [[John Ritter]]
[[Nancy Morgan]] | relatives = {{unbulleted list|[[Tex Ritter]]
{{small|(grandfather)}}
[[Dorothy Fay]] {{small|(grandmother)}}
[[Tyler Ritter]]
{{small|(brother)}}
[[Amy Yasbeck]] {{small|(stepmother)}}}} | spouse = | children = | partner = {{unbulleted list|[[Marianna Palka]]
{{small|(1999–2013)}}|[[Melanie Lynskey]] {{small|(2013–present)}} }} | website =}} '''Jason Ritter''' (born February 17, 1980) is an American actor. He is known for his roles as Kevin Girardi in the television series ''[[Joan of Arcadia]]'', Ethan Haas in ''[[The Class (TV series)|The Class]]'', Sean Walker in the [[National Broadcasting Company|NBC]] series ''[[The Event]]'', and as the voice of [[Dipper Pines]] in ''[[Gravity Falls]]''. He also played the recurring role of Mark Cyr in the NBC television series ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]'', for which he received an [[Primetime Emmy Awards|Emmy Award]] nomination. In 2017, he starred in the TV comedy series ''[[Kevin (Probably) Saves the World]]''. ==Early life== Ritter was born on February 17, 1980 in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], to actors [[Nancy Morgan]] and [[John Ritter]]. He is also a grandson of actors [[Tex Ritter]] and [[Dorothy Fay]]. His stepmother is actress [[Amy Yasbeck]]. The actor has three siblings, including actor [[Tyler Ritter]]. Ritter first appeared in the [[opening credits]] of his father's show, ''[[Three's Company]]''. He was the little blonde haired boy running up to Joyce DeWitt in the petting zoo scene.{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/jason-ritter|title=Jason Ritter Bio|journal=US Weekly |accessdate=27 April 2013}}{{cite journal|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/jason-ritter/bio/156004 |title=Jason Ritter Biography|journal=TV Guide|accessdate=27 April 2013}} He attended middle and high school at the [[Crossroads School (Santa Monica, California)|Crossroads School]] in [[Santa Monica, California]], with [[Simon Helberg]], who became his roommate at NYU.{{cite web|url=http://www.nerdist.com/2011/07/making-it-1-jason-ritter/|title=Making It #1: Jason Ritter|last=Lindhome|first=Riki|work=[[The Nerdist Podcast|Nerdist]]|accessdate=26 July 2011}} He then attended and graduated from [[New York University]]'s [[Tisch School of the Arts]], where he studied at the [[Atlantic Theater Company]]. He also studied at the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] in London, UK. ==Career== [[File:JasonRitter.jpg|thumb|left|215x215px|Ritter in 2007]] Ritter appeared in ''[[The Dreamer of Oz: The L. Frank Baum Story]]'', co-starring as Baum's son alongside his own father. In 2002, he appeared in the movies ''PG'' and ''[[Swimfan]]''. In 2003, Ritter had a major role in the [[slasher film|slasher]]/[[horror film]] ''[[Freddy vs. Jason]]'' as Will Rollins. He appeared in ''[[Raise Your Voice]]'' and ''[[Happy Endings (film)|Happy Endings]]''. He portrayed [[Jeb Bush]] in the [[Oliver Stone]] film ''[[W. (film)|W]]''. In 2007, he also voiced substitute teacher, Mr. Fisk, in an episode of ''[[All Grown Up!]]'', the grown up version of ''Rugrats'', a teacher whom Angelica falls in love with. In 2008, he released ''[[Good Dick]]'', a movie which he produced and starred in along with his long term girlfriend at the time, [[Marianna Palka]] (with whom he began a relationship after meeting in [[Queens, New York|Queens]] in October 1999),{{cite web|title=L.A. Is For Lovers: Jason Ritter & Marianna Palka |first=Whitney |last=Spaner |publisher=Paper Magazine |url=http://www.papermag.com/2009/01/la_is_for_lovers_jason_ritter_marianna_palka.php |date=January 2009 |access-date=2015-10-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402163250/http://www.papermag.com/2009/01/la_is_for_lovers_jason_ritter_marianna_palka.php |archivedate=April 2, 2015 }} who also wrote and directed the film. Among his theater credits are [[Wendy Wasserstein]]'s ''[[Third (play)|Third]]'' at Lincoln Center, for which he won the [[Clarence Derwent Award]] and the Martin E. Segal Award for his portrayal of the title character; the [[Off Broadway]] production of ''The Beginning of August'', and the role of Tim in the world premiere of [[Neil LaBute]]'s play ''The Distance From Here'' at London's Almeida Theatre. Ritter has volunteered as an actor with the [[Young Storytellers Program]]. In 2012, Ritter starred in the [[Disney Channel]] series, ''[[Gravity Falls]]'', a show about twins [[Dipper Pines|Dipper]] and [[Mabel Pines]] who are sent to live with their "Grunkle" [[Stanley Pines|Stan]], and decipher the weird events of Gravity Falls, Oregon. Ritter voiced Dipper in the show. {{cite web |title=Gravity Falls (TV Series 2012–2016) - IMDb |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1865718/ |website=IMDb |publisher=IMDb |accessdate=22 June 2018}} Ritter has appeared in the MTV show ''[[Punk'd]]''. Ritter also starred as Sean Walker in the season-long [[NBC]] drama series ''[[The Event]]'', which premiered on September 20, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2010/05/07/nbc-picks-up-three-new-series-for-2010-11-season-with-the-event-outsourced-and-love-bites/20100507nbc01 |title=NBC Picks Up Three New Series for 2010-11 Season with "The Event", "Outsourced" and "Love Bites"|date=May 7, 2010|work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=May 16, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://livefeed.hollywoodreporter.com/2010/05/nbc-fall-schedule-2010-11.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100518141626/http://livefeed.hollywoodreporter.com/2010/05/nbc-fall-schedule-2010-11.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=May 18, 2010 |title=NBC's fall schedule, upfront revealed |date=May 16, 2010 |last=Hibberd |first=James |series=The Live Feed |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=May 16, 2010 }} Ritter will be seen alongside [[Kate French]] in the upcoming [[short film]], ''Atlantis'', a romance film centered on two strangers who fall in love during the preparation for the final launch of the [[NASA]] [[space shuttle]] ''[[Space Shuttle Atlantis|Atlantis]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/entertainment/movies/os-atlantis-shuttle-launch-movie-20110709,0,2593868.story|work=Orlando Sentinel|title=Movie was filmed as space shuttle Atlantis took off from KSC|date= 9 July 2011|accessdate= 9 July 2011}} He had a recurring role on [[NBC]]'s ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]''.{{cite web|last=Ng|first=Philiana|title='Parenthood': Jason Ritter to Return in Season 3, Teaming Up With Jason Katims for Drama|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/parenthood-jason-ritter-return-season-208861|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=November 29, 2013|date=July 7, 2011}}{{cite web|last=Masters|first=Megan|title=Parenthood Scoop: Jason Ritter Will Return in Season 4… But For How Long?|url=http://tvline.com/2012/06/05/jason-ritter-parenthood-season-4/|work=[[TVLine]]|accessdate=November 29, 2013|date=June 5, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|title=Parenthood Exclusive: Jason Ritter Set to Return|url=http://tvline.com/2013/11/14/parenthood-season-5-jason-ritter-returning-mark-cyr/|work=[[TVLine]]|accessdate=November 29, 2013|date=November 14, 2013}} His performance on the show earned him an [[Emmy Award]] nomination in 2012.{{cite web|last=Adly McKenzie|first=Carina Adly|title=Emmys 2012: Jason Ritter talks 'Parenthood' nomination and Simon Helberg's early-morning text message|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2012/07/emmys-2012-jason-ritter-talks-parenthood-nomination-and-simon-helbergs-early-morning-text-message.html|work=[[Zap2it]]|accessdate=November 29, 2013|date=July 19, 2012}} It was confirmed in early March 2013 that he would play Gavin opposite [[Alexis Bledel]]'s Stacey in ''[[Us & Them]]'', [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]]'s [[sitcom]] [[television pilot|pilot]] based on the British television show ''[[Gavin & Stacey]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/03/alexis-bledel-to-star-in-fox-comedy-pilot-friends-family/|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=Alexis Bledel To Star in FOX Comedy Pilot 'Friends & Family'|work=Deadline Hollywood|date=March 2, 2013|accessdate=27 April 2013}} Ritter has also been featured in the American period sitcom ''[[Another Period]]'' as Lord Frederick Bellacourt. His character is the illiterate twin brother of Beatrice, with whom he is involved in an incestuous relationship. In 2018, Ritter had a supporting role in ''[[The Tale]]'', an autobiographical feature film written and directed by [[Jennifer Fox (documentary filmmaker)|Jennifer Fox]]. The film premiered at the [[2018 Sundance Film Festival]] on January 20, 2018 and later on [[HBO]] on May 26th, 2018. ==Personal life== In 2017, Ritter became engaged to actress [[Melanie Lynskey]] after four years of dating.{{cite web|last1=Heller|first1=Corinne|title=Jason Ritter and Melanie Lynskey Are Engaged|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/830039/jason-ritter-and-melanie-lynskey-are-engaged|website=E!|accessdate=February 16, 2017}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !
